metadata.Title: CVE-2023-0210 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: A bug affects the Linux kernelâ€™s ksmbd NTLMv2 authentication and is known to crash the OS immediately in Linux-based systems. It was discovered that the KSMBD implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly validate buffer lengths, leading to a heap-based buffer overflow. A remote attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

notes.Note: sbeattie> needs ksmbd-tools installed to enable the service, which is not installed by default.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
